definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: And you should be glad to go home, and to see him.
sentences.chinese: 你應該歡歡喜喜地回家去見他。

sentences.english: Two hours ago you went to attend the class party in high spirits.
sentences.chinese: 兩個小時之前你歡歡喜喜的出去參加同學聚會了啊。

sentences.english: So they sang praises with gladness and bowed their heads and worshiped.
sentences.chinese: 他們就歡歡喜喜地頌讚耶和華，低頭敬拜。

sentences.english: She took him into her father's house, and when her father saw him, he gladly welcomed him.
sentences.chinese: 她父見了那人，便歡歡喜喜地迎接。

sentences.english: The birth of a baby is usually an occasion for joy.
sentences.chinese: 人們因孩子的出生而歡歡喜喜歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing .
sentences.chinese: 找著了，就歡歡喜喜的扛在肩上，回到家裏。

definition: happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
